name: charis
meaning: In Greek mythology, a Charis is one of the Charites (Greek: Χάριτες) or 'Graces', goddesses of charm, beauty, nature, human creativity and fertility; and in Homer's Iliad, Charis is the wife of Hephaestus. Charis was also known as Cale ('Beauty') or Aglaea ('Splendor'). Charis is also the Spartan name of a Grace.
